answers.answer: Possible Gerd? Not sure, but how do you know it is swollen lymph nodes? Did they scan his throat? So many possibilities it is hard to say. If you are worried about lymphoma it is usually accompanied by many other symptoms. Google the side effects of the medications. Best thing would come from that appointment you made.

question: My husband was in the hospital for a stroke on May 9, 2008.  The doctor prescribed a new BP medication called Enalapril 5mg x 2 day.  Around 10 days after he came out of the hospital, he began complaining of his throat area being swollen.  He also complained that it was more uncomfortable when he lied down.  He has several other medical conditions and thought originally that the throat problem had to due with his bulging C6 and C7 which has caused him alot of back pain. He also has a  history of kidney stones, gout (on medication ), diabetes Type II (on metaformin 1 per day) and of course high blood pressure. It has gotten to a poitn where he feels it is had to swollen.  He is taking an Allevel at night in order to deal with the pain. I made an appointment with an ENT doctor for tomorrow morning. I am thinking he has had an allergic reaction from the medication  because the symptoms began soon after the enalapril was prescribed.  Any feedback or thoughts would be appreciated.  Thank you!
title: Swollen Lymph Nodes - angioedema?
